info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:45AM CDT until July 14 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN FRANKLIN...SOUTHERN CRAWFORD...SEBASTIAN AND NORTHEASTERN LE FLORE COUNTIES... At 345 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 2 miles northwest of Dyer to near Fort Smith Regional Airport to 3 miles east of Spiro, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Charleston... Greenwood... Alma... Barling... Pocola... Lavaca... Arkoma... Mulberry... Dyer... Hackett... Huntington... Bonanza... Branch... Midland... Denning... Rudy... Excelsior... Fort Smith Regional Airport... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 4 and 23. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 26. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
